subject: No runnable methods exceptions using JUNIT 4.0 TestSuite with eclipse 3.2.1
msgSnippet: Hi, I am NEW to JUNIT and Eclipse.  I have eclipse 3.2.1 that comes with JUNIT 4.0.  I have created a TestSuite using Eclipse wizards.  When i run the
messageBody:
Hi,

I am NEW to JUNIT and Eclipse. I have eclipse 3.2.1 that comes with
JUNIT 4.0. I have created a TestSuite using Eclipse wizards. When i
run the TestSuite it fails with

java.lang.Exception: No runnable methods
at
org.junit.internal.runners.TestClassMethodsRunner.testAborted(TestClassM\
ethodsRunner.java:42)
at
org.junit.internal.runners.TestClassMethodsRunner.run(TestClassMethodsRu\
nner.java:33)
at
org.junit.internal.runners.TestClassRunner$1.runUnprotected(TestClassRun\
ner.java:42)
at
org.junit.internal.runners.BeforeAndAfterRunner.runProtected(BeforeAndAf\
terRunner.java:34)
at
org.junit.internal.runners.TestClassRunner.run(TestClassRunner.java:52)
at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit4.runner.JUnit4TestReference.run(JUnit4Tes\
tReference.java:38)
at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.TestExecution.run(TestExecution.ja\
va:38)
at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.runTests(RemoteTe\
stRunner.java:460)
at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.runTests(RemoteTe\
stRunner.java:673)
at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.run(RemoteTestRun\
ner.java:386)
at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.junit.runner.RemoteTestRunner.main(RemoteTestRu\
nner.java:196)

but when i run the individual Test for each class they work fine.

-->>AllTest.java looks like

package com.xxxxxxx.model.domain;

import junit.framework.Test;
import junit.framework.TestSuite;

public class AllTests {

public static Test suite() {
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite("Test for com.xxxxxxx.model.domain");
//$JUnit-BEGIN$
suite.addTestSuite(ProductTest.class);
//suite.addTestSuite(ShippingTest.class);
//suite.addTestSuite(OrderTest.class);
//suite.addTestSuite(CustEmpTest.class);
//$JUnit-END$
return suite;
}

}

-->>ProductTest.java looks like

package com.xxxxxxx.model.domain;


import junit.framework.TestCase;

import org.junit.Before;
import org.junit.Test;


/**
* JUnit Test Class to test Equals and Validate Method for Product
domain Object
*
*/
public class ProductTest extends TestCase{

@Before
public void setUp() throws Exception {

//super.setUp();

}

@Test
public void testEquals(){

System.out.println("starting testEquals()");

Product p1 = new Product(1,"xxxxxxxxx",50.00,100,0);
Product p2 = new Product(1,"xxxxxxxxx",50.00,100,0);

assertTrue("p1 does NOT equal p2", p1.equals(p2));


}

@Test
public void testValidate(){

System.out.print("starting testValidate()");

Product p1 = new Product();

assertFalse("New Product is valid and should not be!",p1.validate());

}
}

Please note that i have added the @Test and @Before annotations from the
information i found on web. There where not there initially.

Thanks for Help in Advance.
